Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The tea in Nepal is very hot.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: But the coffee in Peru is much hotter. [Erin buzzes him into the office]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Last week I finally became permanent manager of Dunder Mifflin Scranton. My first project: increase security. I got these doors from a jewelry store that had recently gone out of business. Now they're protecting America's real treasure, paper. Every morning I email the day's security codes. Something that's been really missing from my life has been writing secret codes. It's not the KGB, but it's a start.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: The tea in Nepal is very hot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But the coffee in Peru is far hotter.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Close.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is Tuesday, right? The coffee in Paraguay is far hotter?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Colder.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The coffee in Paraguay is colder?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, I meant you're getting colder. The correct response is, "the coffee in Peru is much hotter."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, much, ok.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But, that's three wrong, so I gotta give you the steam. [Dwight begins to protest] Unless you want me to break protocol?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no. Give me the steam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's just harmless steam to panic intruders. I'd like to get harmful steam, but the prices are absurd.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [while getting steamed] Break protocol! Break protocol! Break protocol!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [carrying in clothes on hangers] Oh, I'm saving a fortune on dry cleaning.

Quote.Speaker: Philip
Quote.Text: Mama!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela, someone wants you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok, coming. Hi, baby.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Angela's divorce from the senator has been very difficult for her. When she got kicked out of her apartment, I invited her to move in with me. Ironic that it's Angela who's living in the closet. Hey-o.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Saddle shoes. With denim? I will literally call child services.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Go get 'em, honey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, don't worry. They'll get got.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Manager of Dunder Mifflin? Check. Owner of a 1600-acre beet farm? Check. Engaged to be married to an actual milkmaid? Check... on that later today. This is my grandmother's ring. It was made from a bullet I took out of her left buttock. She was a moonshiner shot by Adolph Coors. This is my grandmother's buttock bullet ring.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello, good morning. My name is Andrew Bernard. You might know me from a TV documentary that's premiering tonight. I also killed it in local theater and I am fresh off of a hot industrial flick.

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: Ok, thanks. Go ahead and get in the back of the line.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, burned all my bridges at Dunder Mifflin, and time to become the next American Idol. By winning America's Next A Cappella Sensation. On channel TBD. It's a really cool show, it's like a revision of the whole American Idol, Voice, Sing-Off phenomenon. On this show, all three judges are mean!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sales form for you to sign.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what to do. [waits for Jim to put form in inbox, signs it and returns it to outbox] Ok

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Behind every great regional manager is a great assistant to the regional manager, and I have chosen one of the best.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Aw, thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Once upon a time we were natural enemies, but we've overcome our differences. Much like Germany and Italy in World War--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good call. Together we run a no-nonsense office.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pre-conference room meeting with Dwight went really well.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, bodes well for the post-conference room meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All depends on the conference room meeting itself. [phone chimes] Uh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is that them again?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe you should call back?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I will. I will.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The guys at Athlead are still bugging me about this three month roadshow thing. Meeting athletes on their home turf, building relationships. Yeah, it sounds exciting. But I said no, and that's final. I almost lost Pam over this business. I'm not risking that again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When Jim decided to come back to Scranton full-time, I was relieved, but I also feel a little guilty. I mean, he's giving up this big thing for me. But he seems happy. I mean, he's certainly been goofing around a lot. I love goofy Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He welcomes you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please take an agenda item.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Your agenda-taking pleases him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Have a seat, Phyllis. There we go. As you know, I like to begin each day with an inspirational quote. "Some say the only failure there is is the failure to try." [buzzer sound] That is wrong. Failure of any kind is failure. Jim, over to you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Let's not get crazy and ruin our no-nonsense streak, all right? So, for instance, if you're expecting a fax today, please don't yell out, "Michael J. Fax from Fax to the Future." Ok? That's nonsense.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Question.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, beautiful girl in the front.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We are expecting a water delivery today at 10am. What if, as they're delivering the water jugs, someone screams out, "Nice jugs"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's obviously nonsense. Nonsense. And what percentage of nonsense do we tolerate in this office?

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: [overlapping] Zero. No nonsense. You can't have nonsense.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [as Angela enters with Phillip] What is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Daycare won't take Phillip anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Apparently my station in life has descended to a depth even they won't forgive. So, hi.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hi, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. Um, new agenda item. Phillip will be joining us in the office today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Gotta write that down. Ok, big day today. Airing of the documentary. Who's excited?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I'd better come out of this smelling like a rose. I've been on my best behavior for nine years. If it wasn't for the cameras, I would've done some truly vulgar crap.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Over the course of this documentary I've had three affairs. If you find my body in a ditch, let me save the police some trouble: my wife did it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm letting you all off half an hour early to view the documentary. So you can make it up to me by working an extra half an hour tomorrow, or a minute extra for the rest of the month.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Ooh, announcement! Some of us whose televisions got broken during an all-you-can-eat shrimp commercial will be watching tonight at Poor Richard's. But note, all are welcome, not just those whose saw an all-you-can-eat shrimp commercial and charged their televisions.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can't believe the doc is finally going to air. When this thing started, I was still having sex with women. As was Kevin, I believe.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: This airs tonight? Oh my god. If my parents see this, I am toast.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This is really huge. This is like the March on Washington but for a singing show. Can you imagine if Martin Luther King were here? And sang "I Dreamed a Dream" from Les Mis? With that baritone? That would be historic.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Whoo-hoo! Casey Dean! Cincinnati, Ohio! [singing] Doctor, doctor, gimme the news, I got a great Casey Dean for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: America wants it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, this is my time! You don't belt on my time! I belt on my time.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: [singing] Casey Dean!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [vocalizing over her] Casey Dean!

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Man, those are some nice pipes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: What's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andy. What's yours?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why didn't you pack the apple snacks?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why didn't you pack the apple snacks?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Because whenever I pack the bag, you say I do it wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why don't you pack it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Guys.

Quote.Speaker: Angela & Oscar
Quote.Text: Kevin, what?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you want to see a video of a weatherman who says "bold front" instead of "cold front"? It's insane.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Not now, Kevin. Can't you see we're busy? Phillip needs his apple snacks.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Seriously, Kevin. I'm just gonna have to go to the store.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok, you go to the store.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Philllip, Phillip, Phillip. It's all about Phillip. I hate Phillip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not now! Private time!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love Star Wars as much as the next guy--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, hey! Seriously? [holds up Battlestar Galactica model box]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: My god, I'm so sorry. Well this might make up for it: I think I have found an enormous source of overlooked PFN.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Which is, of course...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Potential future nonsense.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, good abbreviating, Jim. That saved some time. Now, hurry up, shut the door. Break it down for me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna need you to look at your hierarchy mobile. You've got a regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The power source.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Obviously, the assistant to the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A loyal, but bungling apostle.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But what about the assistant assistant to the regional manager?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Someone to whisper in the ear of the consigliore.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'd have to get some more wire and string, but it's doable. Do you think any of them out there are capable?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, right. I mean, unless they're willing to pass some tests.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I like the sound of that. Who do you have in mind?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, I know this sounds crazy, but how would King Arthur choose the next knight of his round table?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That doesn't sound crazy, Jim. That's the sanest thing I've ever heard.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: What're you listening to?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm? Um, uh, locking in my starting note. A 440.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Oh, sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: A cappella is all about pitch, and I am nothing if not a total pitch bitch.

Quote.Speaker: Mark McGrath
Quote.Text: What's up, everybody? And welcome to America's Next A Cappella Singing Sensation!

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Ah! It's Mark McGrath! Oh my god! You're gorgeous!

Quote.Speaker: Mark McGrath
Quote.Text: Thank you, thank you so much. And thank you for your patience. And we hope to see you guys within the next five to seven hours. Now, just to give you a couple parameters of the show, each of you will sing a song for thirty seconds, after which our judges will decide if they want you in their a cappella group. Now, each group will start with 90 singers, which will compete in a series of singing and physical challenges. Oh, and look out for that pesky mole!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's a mole?

Quote.Speaker: Mark McGrath
Quote.Text: Oops. I'm not supposed to--I'm not supposed to say that. All right, no mole. Forget I said it, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What mole? What are you talking about? I already forgot about it.

Quote.Speaker: Mark McGrath
Quote.Text: Good man right there. I'll see you guys inside. Good luck, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Pour some Sugar Ray on me!

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: What? On a roll much?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't know where it came from.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: That was amazing, man!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. Yeah, it felt good. It felt funny.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Yeah, you made a personal connection with him.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I did, I felt it.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Big time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you so excited about?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What are you up to?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Members of the office, hear ye.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That means ye, Plop!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Plop? Still?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We owe Andy that much. Am I right people?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Fine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Today we will be testing candidates for the position of assistant to the assistant to the regional manager.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Aw, heck ya!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nice.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You'll always have the upper hand, when you've got a good a-arm. Trademark pending.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is not an excuse to blow off work doing carnival-like activities. Sure, every participant will be getting a corndog, but that's for fueling only. No savoring.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow, the honor. God, I envy them.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He envies you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't need to repeat right now, when I'm saying it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: By 2:00, Dwight will chose himself to be assistant to his own assistant, me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What up?

Quote.Speaker: Glenn
Quote.Text: What's going on? How was the delivery?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Delivered all my furniture to Philly. Hey, keep it down, though. Nobody knows I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I hate goodbyes, so last week, when I left Dunder Mifflin for good, I pulled the old Irish Exit. Just slipped out without making a big deal. No hard feelings. No feelings at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: A good assistant knows what their superior is thinking before they even think it. Meredith, what number am I thinking of right now?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Uh, two.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not even close, Meredith. Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Pam. What song is running through my head right now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Theme song from Saved by the Bell.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, my god! It was the theme song to Boy Meets World.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, no, no, no, stop. Spouses can read each other's minds. You're trying to give your wife this job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's exactly what I was doing. Plop, what animal am I picturing?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: A horse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ew, the exact opposite, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What's the opposite of a horse?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim & Dwight
Quote.Text: Sea horse.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whoa. How did you know that I was gonna--

Quote.Speaker: Jim & Dwight
Quote.Text: Say that? Uncanny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Challenge number two, protocol. Clark?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you want a corn dog?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I would love a corn dog.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We'll see. You are an assistant who's just gotten a phone message. I am in a meeting with Dwight, Robert Dunder, and his niece. Uh-oh, look who came to join us. The Turkish ambassador to Armenia, Yuri Slovak, who, by the way, is extremely embarrassed about the size of his nose. Go ahead and read that phone message.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [reading] Mr. Halpert, your wife called to find out how your meeting with Yuri Big Nose went."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no! You don't read it aloud like that! God! Besides, the whole thing is a trick question. There's no Turkish ambassador to Armenia. The two countries don't have diplomatic relations.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uncanny.

Quote.Speaker: Soldier
Quote.Text: I just hope that if my buddies who are still in Afghanistan see me win, they'll feel like anything is possible.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great, more screen time for the war vet. All you gotta do is risk your life for this country and everyone goes gaga for you.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Over at the porta-potties, they were interviewing a homeless, single mother with three kids.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is this a show about the resiliency of the human spirit? Or is it a show about singing?

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: I don't know. But I'm getting really worried here.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me too. Hold my place in line.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They want feel-good stories? Wait until they get a good feel of me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yep. Take care.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Darryl, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cool, are you coming back to say hi?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, no, I'm not here actually. These donuts are part of my escape from the guys at the warehouse I didn't say goodbye to.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aha. How's Athlead?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: We livin' like rock stars. I'm about to eat free steaks with my sports heroes in 32 different cities.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Jim really doesn't want to come?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He says he doesn't want to.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Wow. Man. I hope he doesn't regret it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, he seems really happy being back here at Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Jim is happy here, selling paper at Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's what he says.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: If you say so. Hey, good seeing you. Remember, I was never here. All right, then.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: An assistant brings their boss coffee with speed and dexterity. But an assistant to the assistant has a thousand times more to prove, am I right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: A thousand times more.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'll try this one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phyllis! Grab both these coffees, double-fist it, and head through this obstacle course.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [grabbing the coffee] Hot!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. It's real. It's the only way you'll learn. OK, and go ahead. [Phyllis carefully makes her way through the obstacle course] Oh, god, nice! She's through the green, everybody. Here comes yellow, real doozy. Careful!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [over Jim] No, no, no! Phyllis, seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look at that form.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [running over and taking the coffee cups from Phyllis] Oh, god, this is pathetic! The boss needs his coffee! [races through obstacles, spilling coffee] Augh! Ah! Here you are, sir! Here's your coffee! Ah, my skin, ow, ow! It burns! Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uncanny. [everyone applauds]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Darryl?! Darryl!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, hey. Hey, what's up, y'all?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You left us without saying goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, my bad. Goodbye, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey! No way!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's totally uncool.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? You broke our hearts. Get upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't think I sh-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Get upstairs, mister!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Right. Now.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Guess I'm going upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, Dwight, this whole search for the assistant thing--none of these people are good enough.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What I'm about to say makes no logical sense, and yet, it might be the most logical thing I've ever said.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, this is gonna come as no surprise but I know exactly what you are going to say. The only possible assistant to my assistant-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The new assistant to the assistant to the regional manager is Dwight K. Schrute.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! [weak applause] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think you might want to kneel for this. And yet, the manager for Dunder Mifflin kneels for no one. [Dwight awkwardly squats] That's it. You look really, really good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, from now on, anyone who needs to speak to me has got to go through me first, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You all right? What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you happy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, I'm happy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I know that you're, like, happy and, like, you had fun today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And that was fun. But what about a year from now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about five years from now?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Because I'm so glad you're back, baby, but I'm just--I was talking to Darryl, and he was talking about the trip, and I just feel like you're giving up so much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This was my decision, not yours.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You didn't force me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I kind of forced you to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You did not force me to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, I did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know how else to tell you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm afraid that you're gonna resent me and I'm afraid that--

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Resent you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: This is not enough for you and I'm afraid that I'm not enough for you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that really what you think?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not enough? I don't know how else to explain it to her, so, you know what? I know it's against the rules but I'm gonna need a favor from you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Camera Crew
Quote.Text: Okay. You got it, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I didn't realize we were this close.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We're all a little hormonal with the doc airing.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Are you gonna come to Poor Richard's and watch with us tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Uh... yeah. Depending on traffic.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: He ain't coming.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, god!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: These dudes are definitely in a weird mood. Picked the wrong day to return a truck.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, it's been great.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Eleven years. A guy is in your life for 11 years and then he's gone for who knows how long.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Maybe forever. Anyhow--

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Did we ever have lunch together, just--just the two of us? You know what, I'm gonna make reservations right now at Cugino's.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Question for Darryl. Did we ever get loaded and listen to Zeppelin in my van?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, I'm sure we did.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Nah, I call one hour van time with Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Darryl, you know, I would love to just record some of your stories, just let the tape roll for six or eight or ten hours and just see what we get.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Listen guys, we can do it all. We just have to divide Darryl's next 12 hours into 90-minute segments. I will go watch an eHow video on how to use Excel, and then we'll get this started.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Wait a minute. Okay, I made the mistake of sneaking out of here and that's on me. But I'm not gonna spend the rest of the day here doing stuff with you cause you're feeling sentimental.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You have to! [everyone grumbling]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey. I'll do one thing with y'all.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Which thing?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't care, choose amongst yourselves. Not the van though.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, you know my name. Well, that is shocking. [continues making noise]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, could you not do that?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What? I'm moving the ink down in my pen, for work.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Here, use my pen.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Don't tell me what to do!

Quote.Speaker: Angela & Oscar
Quote.Text: Shhh!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, I don't need this! And you obviously don't need me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Kevin, where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Away. Tell Phillip that his stupid little baby wish came true.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: He just won't go down. It's as if he's excited by all this paper.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I know. Earlier today he tried to eat some of the 24-weight letter bond.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Smart baby. That's the most flavorful bond.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, what's goin' on over here? Some sort of singing competition for the young'uns?

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: You're back!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, it's me, Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: No, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, no, no. I'm wearing makeup.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: You did a really great job. You even look shorter.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, I took out my lifts.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, unlike Andy Bernard, this character is my real height.

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: All day long, it's moo the cows and cluck the hens. Get the sheep baa-ed. Oink the pigs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oink the pigs, that is very important. [watching Phillip]

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Dwight, I'm telling you about all the things that ma said after the horse kicked her in the head. Where are you? Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The way that boy looks at the Galactica is precisely the way I look at the Galactica. And he eats the same kind of paper I do. Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [puts his grandmother's ring away] Thank you, Esther.

Quote.Speaker: Esther
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Dwight throws "Now" beanie at Jim's head]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You threw the summoning bag at me, sir?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need you to perform a test.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Perform a test.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: On an innocent baby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, I like where this is going. Unfortunately I have a lot of work today so I'm gonna have to hand this off to my number two. But, don't worry, he's the best in the biz.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn straight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Unless you think he can't handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, he can handle it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [holding Phillip] Listen, listen. Shh, buddy. Stanley's sleeping. You don't want to wake up the grumpy old walrus, do you?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I heard that.

Quote.Speaker: Phillip
Quote.Text: Mama.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, you want me to take the little diaper blaster? Pam can attest, there's no one better at getting brats to shut their yaps.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He does have a gift.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, he's calling for his mom, but, okay, here, here you go. Careful, he bites.

Quote.Speaker: Phillip
Quote.Text: Mama.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay. [takes Phillip who immediately stops crying] You ever been in a manager's office before?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Phillip, you wanna play a little game? It's called "Schrute or Consequences." You're gonna choose one of these two things. A check for a million dollars, or this dirty old beet. Yuck, pew! Which will it be? Money or the beet?

Quote.Speaker: Phillip
Quote.Text: Beet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Any ordinary child would have taken the money, but you're no ordinary child are you? No. I can tell by your gorgeous, widely-set eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: Sorry, folks, the judges are totally swamped. We are all done taking auditions.

Quote.Speaker: People in line
Quote.Text: Oh come on! Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, what?

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: But thanks for coming out and be sure to watch America's Next A Cappella Sensa--

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. You can't do that. You can't do that, we've all been waiting.

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I am going in there! Don't--

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: No, you're not, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't--don't--

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: Please don't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Don't touch me.

Quote.Speaker: Check-in guy
Quote.Text: I'm not touching you. Okay? [Andy makes a break for it]

Quote.Speaker: Casey
Quote.Text: Run, old man! Run! Run! Run for your life! Get off. Don't you dare. Don't get--I could see it. You were gonna get handsy with me. Not interested. I'm Casey Dean! You'll be seeing the last of me. Er, I meant you won't be seeing the last of me!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey. Did you manage to feed him? I don't know what it is. He just keeps spitting out the nipple.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That is because this baby is of superior intelligence. He can tell when he's being tricked out of the experience of a real human breast.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He's not that smart. He doesn't know where I hid his duck.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [interrupting contestant singing "Beautiful" by Christina Aguilera] Hi. You're still here. Oh, thank god. Clay Aiken, Santigold, Aaron Rodgers. You're like, my three favorite people ever.

Quote.Speaker: Santigold
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [shushing contestant] Sweetheart, you're amazing, okay? You're obviously gonna be on the show, so it's someone else's turn now. Yeah, go ahead. All right, [old man voice] my name is Ezra Cornell and I'm just a kindly old fellow with a song in my heart.

Quote.Speaker: Aaron Rodgers
Quote.Text: No, you're a middle-aged man with a lot of makeup on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Busted. Yes, got it. All right. Tried to get your attention with tricks, but you just want to hear me sing, I respect that.

Quote.Speaker: Clay Aiken
Quote.Text: No, we do not want to hear you sing.

Quote.Speaker: Santigold
Quote.Text: Gabriella was our last audition. Thank you. Goodbye.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nope! Can't end like this. Slept in my car last night, quit my job, burned all my bridges. I went to the bathroom on my boss's car. And I did unspeakable things with Carla Fern.

Quote.Speaker: Aaron Rodgers
Quote.Text: Flag on the play.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's--that's what--yeah. Okay, all right, well, here's the song. [singing] Far above Cayuga's waters, with her waves so blue, stands our noble alma mater--

Quote.Speaker: Santigold
Quote.Text: What is this song?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are you insane? It's the Cornell fight song.

Quote.Speaker: Clay Aiken
Quote.Text: Listen, all right, thank you very much, we're not interested.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You didn't let me finish. That's not fair.

Quote.Speaker: Aaron Rodgers
Quote.Text: Look, man, you're not terrible. We've heard a lot of really good singers today and you're just not good enough.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow, you guys are really mean. I guess that's the show. Let me try a different song, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Aaron Rodgers
Quote.Text: Can he do this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [singing] Hey, hobo man, hey, dapper Dan, you both got your style, but, brother, you're never fully dressed without a smile. [falters at the judges' reactions] Yeah. Your clothes may be beau brummelly--

Quote.Speaker: Santigold
Quote.Text: Look, you gotta go. [Andy falls to his knees, sobbing] You can't just sit here and cry.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh I can so just sit here and cry!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [addressing camera after opening envelope on his desk] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Kev, how you doing, buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Can't hear you. I'm giving you the silence treatment. How does it feel being ignored?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay, I guess, it's just that Phillip got you something.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, a $25 gift card, iTunes.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I think there's, like, $7 left.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's just his way of saying, "Thanks for letting me hang out in Accounting."

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Phillip got this for me?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That was a really cool move.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Would you like to hold Phillip? [hands off Phillip] Yeah. That's Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Easy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What a chubbers. Whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, watch it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm losing my balance.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, Kevin, no.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, no.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No horseplay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Stop it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You wanna play with the cactus?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, no!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So, me and Phillip were just talking and we decided we're gonna be best friends. He's a little standoffish at first. But once he starts buying you things, man, you can tell he likes you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We have our decision.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You chose one thing?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: We want to dance with you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You want to dance?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: One dance, all of us together.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is what you want?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Absolutely.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Better get some decent speakers up here then, cause we're gonna do this right.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes! [Stanley, Creed, Meredith and Creed all cheer]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hey. You wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Door. Chair. It's about Phillip.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I am sorry he's here today but I had--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I believe that boy may be a Schrute. And if he is, that child needs to be accorded what is his. An enormous farm, an inheritance, and the right to be raised under rigorous Schrute traditions. You will, of course, be compensated with a marriage proposal.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How thoughtful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Then the two of you would move to my 1,600-acre estate, which, let's face it, is a big step up from living in a gay man's closet.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: If he is your son, that's a great plan. But he's not. He's not your son.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very well.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can I go back to my desk now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is this?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well I've been trying to tell you how I feel, and you wouldn't believe me, so [shows her DVD] I needed a little help.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim! I need my assistant to the regional manager. Code red.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, I don't have my pocket code chart on me, right now, so.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [throws "now" beanbag at Jim] Now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have an assistant now, who can help you with whatever you need. He is lazy, so crack the whip.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim. I'm not kidding. I need you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, um, this is... [leaves DVD with her]--I'll be right back.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do we got?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was thinking of proposing to Esther today.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! Congratulations, that's a really big step.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: She's got a ton of great qualities. She's young, she's beautiful, genes so pure you could lick them. Her family admires me, my family tolerates hers. A lot of them are the same people because we're third cousins, which is great for bloodlines and isn't technically incest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right in the sweet spot. I think you're gonna be really happy.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Plus her dowry contains a walk-in freezer full of frozen, premium cattle sperm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [whistles] That's a lot of pros.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And did I mention that she weaves? Colorful, durable blankets and rugs! It all adds up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So what is the problem?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam hesitates but puts the DVD into the laptop to watch]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know what you want me to tell you, man. All I know is that every time I've been faced with a tough decision, there's only one thing that outweighs every other concern. One thing that will make you give up on everything you thought you knew, every instinct, every rational calculation.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Some sort of virus?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Pam starts the video; title screen reads "Beesly--You think I'll have regrets. I asked the doc crew to help me show you why I won't..."; highlights of Pam and Jim from the documentary play over Snow Patrol's "Open Your Eyes"]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight, listen: no matter what happens, you gotta forget about all the other stuff. You gotta forget about logic and fear and doubt. You just gotta do everything you can to get to the one woman who's gonna make all this worth it. At the end of the day, you gotta jump. You love Angela, Dwight. I think you always have.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're a good assistant, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not as good as you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's very true. Get the hell outta here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You got it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You watched it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, then I guess you're ready for this. [gives her the Christmas card]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What's that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's from the teapot. Everything you'll ever need to know is in that note. [Pam reads the card] Not enough for me? You are everything.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ok, everybody ready?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hit it, red! ["Boogie Wonderland" by Earth Wind & Fire plays as Darryl dances with each member of the office]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I wanted to leave quietly. It seemed dignified. But having Kevin grind up on my front while Erin pretends to hump me from behind is a more accurate tribute to my years here. I'm gonna miss these guys.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ok, I've got my--

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: See you guys at Poor Richard's, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: All right, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: See you there.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Bye, Phillip. High five.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yay! I am gonna drop Phillip off at my mother's, and I'll meet you at Poor Richard's in an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you sure you don't want me to drop him off?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: She doesn't know I'm living with a straight woman. I don't want to get her hopes up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: All right. Bye, buddy. Bye, bye, bye!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Oh, my goodness.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in bullhorn] Pull over!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Move to the side of the road!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pull over!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do you--Dwight! [Dwight cuts her off in his car, they pull over]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [getting out of her car] Dwight! What the [bleep] is your problem!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on bullhorn still] Shut up, woman!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Who drives like that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen to me! I love you! And I don't care that Phillip's not my son. I will raise 100 children with 100 of your lovers if it means that I can be with you!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Can you put that down?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This expresses how loudly I love you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's too loud.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [puts down bullhorn and kneels] This is a ring, taken from the buttocks of my grandmother, put there by the gangster patriarch of the Coors dynasty, melted in a foundry run by Mennonites.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay, yes--yes, I will! [they kiss] I love you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I love you!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: And I lied to you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phillip's your son.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Why would you say that--

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I just needed you to want to marry me because you wanted to marry me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [excited] Get out! I'm a dad!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're a dad!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, grab a seat. We have that table and that table, but not that table or that table or that table. Floor's up for grabs. Meredith has been hogging the can. [Dwight kisses Creed's head] Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You have to change the channel to PBS.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: College baseball is on.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: But there's a documentary coming up. Everyone in the bar will love it.

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: What's it about?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: A paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: How many people want the game? [half the bar cheers] Who wants PBS? [other half cheers] Sorry. Tie means I do nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Sir, please. This show is about me and my attempts to find love in all the wrong places.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: One more for the doc. [the office staff cheers]

Quote.Speaker: Bartender
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yes!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, how was the singing show audition?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh. Eh, whatever. No big deal.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Ok, thirty seconds to showtime!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I feel scared a little.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm not ready for this.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: No one is ready for this. You can't be ready for this. We don't even know what this is.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: One thing we do know, nothing will ever be the same.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here we go. [documentary starts with the first scene of "Pilot"]
